alert.note: Alert for Black Mesa Area; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264 (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 12:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM CLUSTER WILL IMPACT AREAS ACROSS HOPI AND NAVAJO TRIBAL AREAS IN APACHE AND NAVAJO COUNTIES THROUGH 145 PM NAVAJO NATION TIME /1245 PM AZ TIME/... At 112 PM NAVAJO NATION TIME /1212 PM AZ TIME/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Keams Canyon, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, heavy rainfall, and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rain may result in muddy and impassable roads. Locations impacted include... Keams Canyon, Toyei, Jadito, Jeddito, and Navajo. This includes State Route 264 between mile markers 396 and 423. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to minor flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded or muddy roadways.

area.areaDesc: Black Mesa Area; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264
